page.title: 12Furniture restorer (1)
page.content: The chapel in Pitney became redundant 10 years ago.It lay empty for 4 years until John Perrin moved his furniture restoration business from Bristol to Pitney.He is a Bristolian,but his wife is from Pitney.The chapel interior shows no signs of its original purpose,but outside the gravestones can still be seen.Mr Perrin,who is a cabinet maker,employs a french polisher and 1 apprentice. Their main work is furniture restoration but they also do some upholstery,make kitchen units,tables cupboards and other pieces of furniture to the customers specifications.This year they have made their first long_case clock from scratch,having only restored the cases before.This is the most expensive piece they have ever made_it's final cost will be between Â£1200_Â£1300.
